bioghist.p: Joseph Hergesheimer (1880-1954) was a prominent American novelist and short story writer of the early 20th century. His first novel, The Lay Anthony, was published in 1914. He enjoyed great popularity through the 1910s and 1920s, but his style of writing fell out of favor in the 1930s and his popularity declined.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of manuscripts of Joseph Hergesheimer. The manuscripts are fragmentary. Some contain poetry, and a number of them include multiple drafts of the same passage. Quite a few appear to relate to F. Scott Fitzgerald. The collection also includes bibliographies of Hergesheimer's books and magazine articles, autobiographical passages and a reminiscence of James Branch Cabell by Hergesheimer, an inventory of Mrs. Hergesheimer's collection of books by H. L. Mencken, and several letters from Mrs. Hergesheimer to a friend.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
